Source code for maxaidatahandling.dataset

from abc import ABC

# pyspark imports
from pyspark import SparkContext
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

from maxairesources.logging.logger import get_logger
from maxairesources.utilities.data_connectors import DataFrame
from maxairesources.datachecks.dataframe_analysis_spark import SparkDataFrameAnalyser


spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
logger = get_logger(__name__)



[docs]class MaxDataset(ABC):
    """This class reads and preprocess and summarise loaded data. can be used both for data reader and writer.
    Args:
        name (str): _description_
        dataset_config (dict, optional): _description_. Defaults to None.
        df (spark.DataFrame, optional): _description_. Defaults to None.

    sample config for read mode:
    ``
    {
        "port": 1,
        "dataType": "dataframe",
        "sourceDetails": {
            "source": "s3",
            "fileFormat": "csv",
            "filePath": "dim_customer.csv"
        },
        "preprocess": {
            "rename_cols": {
                "dob": "date_of_birth",
                "is_employee": "is_employee_bool"
            },
            "select_cols": [
                "customer_id",
                "signup_date",
                "date_of_birth",
                "first_store_id",
                "is_employee_bool",
                "is_outlier",
                "gender",
                "language"
            ],
            "re_partition": {
                "on": [
                    "customer_id"
                ],
                "size": 2
            },
            "data_analysis": {
                "col_types": {
                    "numerical_cols": [],
                    "bool_cols": [
                        "is_employee_bool",
                        "is_outlier"
                    ],
                    "categorical_cols": [
                        "gender",
                        "language"
                    ],
                    "free_text_cols": [],
                    "unique_identifier_cols": [
                        "customer_id"
                    ]
                }
            },
            "cache": True
        }
    }
    ``
    # TODO connect it with meta data or mlflow APIs from max
    """

    def __init__(self, name: str, dataset_config: dict = None, df=None):
        self.name = name
        self.dataset_config = dataset_config
        self.port_number = self.dataset_config["port"]
        self.data_health_report = None
        self.data = df
        self.read_mode = True
        if self.data:
            logger.debug(f"dataset {self.name} object created with data in write mode", extra=self.dataset_config)
            self.read_mode = False
        else:
            logger.debug(f"dataset {self.name} object created with config in read mode", extra=self.dataset_config)


[docs]    def prepare_dataset(self):
        if self.read_mode:
            self.__read_data()
            self._custom_preprocessing()
            self.__rename_columns()
            self.__filter_data()
            self.__select_cols()
            self.__repartition_data()
            self.__summarise_data()
            self.__fill_nulls()
            self.__cache_data()
            return self.data
        else:
            logger.warning("dataset object created with data in write mode, reading not allowed")


    def __read_data(self):
        reader_obj = DataFrame(spark_conn=spark)
        self.data = reader_obj.get(input_data=[self.dataset_config], port_number=self.port_number)
        logger.debug(f"raw data read from port {self.port_number} with columns: {self.data.columns}")

    def __rename_columns(self):

        rename_cols = get_key_value(self.dataset_config, "preprocess", "rename_cols")
        if rename_cols:
            logger.info(f"renaming columns", extra=rename_cols)
            for old_name, new_name in rename_cols.items():
                logger.debug(f"renaming {old_name} to {new_name}")
                self.data = self.data.withColumnRenamed(old_name, new_name)
        else:
            logger.debug(f"no rename mapping columns provided")

    def __cache_data(self):
        cache_flag = get_key_value(self.dataset_config, "preprocess", "cache")
        if cache_flag:
            logger.debug(f"cached data")
            self.data = self.data.cache()
        else:
            logger.debug(f"skipping cache {cache_flag}")

    def __fill_nulls(self):
        # TODO : fill nulls with value from config
        pass

    def __summarise_data(self):
        data_analysis_config = get_key_value(self.dataset_config, "preprocess", "data_analysis")
        if data_analysis_config:
            col_types = {
                "numerical_cols": get_key_value(data_analysis_config, "col_types", "numerical_cols"),
                "bool_cols": get_key_value(data_analysis_config, "col_types", "bool_cols"),
                "categorical_cols": get_key_value(data_analysis_config, "col_types", "categorical_cols"),
                "free_text_cols": get_key_value(data_analysis_config, "col_types", "free_text_cols"),
                "unique_identifier_cols": get_key_value(data_analysis_config, "col_types", "unique_identifier_cols"),
            }
            sample_ratio = get_key_value(data_analysis_config, "sample_ratio")
            logger.debug(f"analysing the data with sample ratio of {sample_ratio}", extra=col_types)
            analyst = SparkDataFrameAnalyser(df=self.data, column_types=col_types, sample_ratio=sample_ratio)
            self.data_health_report = analyst.generate_data_health_report()
            logger.debug(f"analysis report", extra=self.data_health_report)
        else:
            logger.debug(f"skipping analysis as no config is provided")

    def __filter_data(self):
        # TODO : filter based on simple categorical columns from config
        pass


[docs]    def store_data(self):
        if self.read_mode:
            logger.warning("dataset {self.name} object created with data in read mode, writing not allowed")
        else:
            self._custom_preprocessing()
            self.__rename_columns()
            self.__filter_data()
            self.__select_cols()
            self.__repartition_data()
            self.__summarise_data()

            writer_obj = DataFrame(spark_conn=spark)
            writer_obj.write(output_data=[self.dataset_config], port_number=self.port_number, df=self.data)
            logger.debug(f"raw data wrote to port {self.port_number}")


    def __select_cols(self):
        select_cols = get_key_value(self.dataset_config, "preprocess", "select_cols")
        if select_cols:
            logger.debug(f"selecting {select_cols} from dataset")
            self.data = self.data.select(*select_cols)
        else:
            logger.debug(f"no columns provided to select")

    def __repartition_data(self):
        partition_cols = get_key_value(self.dataset_config, "preprocess", "re_partition", "on")
        partition_size = get_key_value(self.dataset_config, "preprocess", "re_partition", "size")

        if partition_cols and partition_size:
            logger.debug(f"repartition to {partition_size} with {partition_cols}")
            self.data = self.data.repartition(partition_size, *partition_cols)
        elif partition_cols:
            logger.debug(f"repartition with {partition_cols}")
            self.data = self.data.repartition(partition_cols)
        elif partition_cols:
            logger.debug(f"repartition to {partition_size} partitions")
            self.data = self.data.repartition(partition_size)
        else:
            logger.debug(f"no partition info provided")

    def _custom_preprocessing(self):
        """
        This method could be overwritten in child class of dataset if required customer handling of data before processing
        It runs before all the preprocessing performed while reading or while writing.
        """
        logger.info("no custom data processing performed")
        pass




[docs]def get_key_value(nested_dict: dict, *keys):
    """
    Check if *keys (nested) exists in `element` (dict).
    """
    if not isinstance(nested_dict, dict):
        raise AttributeError("keys_exists() expects dict as first argument.")
    if len(keys) == 0:
        raise AttributeError("keys_exists() expects at least two arguments, one given.")

    _element = nested_dict
    for i, key in enumerate(keys):
        try:
            _element = _element[key]
            if len(keys) - 1 == i:
                return _element
        except KeyError:
            return None
        except Exception as e:
            return None
